de.bpmnaftool.model.bpmn.connectingobject
Interface SequenceFlow

All Superinterfaces:
ConnectingObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
SequenceFlowImpl
public interface SequenceFlow
extends ConnectingObject

A sequence flow is a directed edge between two flow objects inside a pool. It defines the control flow between two nodes. A condition might be set which must be true in order to sequence the control flow.

Author:
Felix Härer

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getCondition()
          Returns a condition which must be true to execute the sequence flow.
 FlowObject getDestinationFlowObject()
          Returns the destination, where the flow object is incoming
 FlowObject getSourceFlowObject()
          Returns the source, where the flow object is outgoing
 boolean isDefaultFlow()
          Returns, whether this is a default flow, meaning that it is executed if no other SequenceFlow with the same Source FlowObject has a true condition.
 void setCondition(java.lang.String condition)
          Sets a condition which must be true to execute the sequence flow.
 void setDefaultFlow()
          Makes this SequenceFlow a default flow, meaning that it is executed if no other SequenceFlow with the same Source FlowObject has a true condition.

Returns the destination, where the flow object is incoming

getCondition

java.lang.String getCondition()
Returns a condition which must be true to execute the sequence flow. If no condition is set, null is returned.

setCondition

void setCondition(java.lang.String condition)
Sets a condition which must be true to execute the sequence flow.

Parameters:
condition - as String

isDefaultFlow

boolean isDefaultFlow()
Returns, whether this is a default flow, meaning that it is executed if no other SequenceFlow with the same Source FlowObject has a true condition.

Returns:
true if SequenceFlow is a default flow, false otherwise

setDefaultFlow

void setDefaultFlow()
Makes this SequenceFlow a default flow, meaning that it is executed if no other SequenceFlow with the same Source FlowObject has a true condition.
